content.rendered:
Tricia and Mark’s spring southern romantic wedding at The Bridge Building was adorable as could be.

The couple kicked off their special day by sharing a first look at Union Station, leaving them both beaming with joy and more excited than ever to finally say “I do.”

At the end of their sweet ceremony, they played “All I do is Win,” and everyone threw their hands in the air. There was so much joy and love in that room.

Following the ceremony, guests sipped, mingled and had a light bite at cocktail hour. Passed appetizers included pepper jelly pimento cheese bruschetta, coconut crusted shrimp and candied bacon deviled eggs.

Meanwhile, the Cumberland space was transformed into an elegant reception filled with navy, gray and lilac hues. Fresh, spring florals by Forget Me Not Designs helped bring the space to life and add timeless elegance. The reception was set up in a circular fashion to keep everyone surrounded by one another.

Guests were then welcomed to the couple’s first dinner as Mr. and Mrs. Faulkner! Dinner stations included a build-your-own-BBQ station and a southern comforts station with four cheese macaroni, fried green tomatoes, hot chicken sliders and more.

For a fun treat, Nashville Event Bartending provided a specialty bourbon tasting bar and plenty of beer for even the most experienced of beer connoisseurs.

Desserts were provided by Dulce Desserts and topped with the most delightful cake topper, depicting Superman and Wonder Woman. Congratulations to our newlyweds, Mr. & Mrs. Faulkner!

WEDDING DETAILS

Date: April 14, 2018
Bride & Groom: Tricia and Mark
Location: The Bridge Building
Guest Count: 68
Colors: Navy, Gray & Lilac
Photographer: Details Nashville
Florist: Forget Me Not Designs
Cake: Dulce Desserts
DJ/Band: DJ Drell
Paper Goods: Darby Cards
Linens: Liberty Party Rental
Bar: Nashville Event Bartending
Catering: The Bridge Building
Production Design: Infinity Hospitality
Planning: Kristina | IH

excerpt.rendered: An intimate, fun-filled spring wedding ceremony and reception at The Bridge Building.
